newsitem.title: PERU: Peru's Backus group merges its four breweries.
newsitem.headline: Peru's Backus group merges its four breweries.

text.p: Shareholders of the four breweries in Peru's Backus group decided on Friday, as expected, to merge the sister companies Backus y Johnston, Compania Nacional de Cerveza, Sociedad Cervecera de Trujillo S.A. and Cerveceria del Norte , group officials said.
"The decision to merge has been taken," said a group director, who asked not to be named, in an interview.
"From December 31 the new company will be called Union de Cevecerias Peruanas."
Backus y Johnston is the country's largest brewery, Compania Nacional de Cerveza is a Lima stock market blue-chip, while the other two firms are small, regional breweries.
The merger, which company officials have said is aimed principally at lowering costs, has been expected since the end of last month when the companies' individual stock prices made strong gains.
The four breweries had total annual sales of $365.7 million in 1995.
